title: Prince Andrew's damaged reputation - podcast
text:
Last week Jeffrey Epstein accuser Virginia Roberts did her first television interview, and in it restated claims that she had been made to have sex with Prince Andrew when she was 17. Royal correspondent Chris Ship discusses the Duke of York’s friendship with deceased paedophile Jeffrey Epstein. And: Labour MP Paula Sherriff on standing up to Boris Johnson

Last week an accuser of Jeffrey Epstein alleged that Prince Andrew was “an abuser, a participant” in the disgraced US financier’s exploitation of her as a teenager, in her first television interview. Virginia Giuffre, formerly Roberts, who was pictured with Prince Andrew in a now notorious photograph, spoke to the US TV network NBC News about her involvement with Epstein, a convicted sex offender who killed himself in a New York jail in August while facing fresh child sex-trafficking charges.

Over the years, Buckingham Palace have had to issue multiple statements denying any inappropriate behaviour from Prince Andrew. Chris Ship, ITV news’ royal editor, talks to Anushka Asthana about the Duke of York’s friendship with Epstein and the damage it has caused his reputation.

And: Labour MP Paula Sherriff on standing up to Boris Johnson and receiving an ugly response.
